title: What are some of the best canned foods? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ali I would imagine that there are as many answers to this question as there are people answering it. Personally I prefer not to use canned foods as fresh and fresh frozen provide much more flavor and, in many cases, nutrition. However, there are times when convenience and time necessitate using canned foods. So, given that I like to use canned items that are versatile or that can be easily elevated. Some of my go to’s are Spam, tuna, salmon, green beans, peas, chick peas, tomatoes and various sauces.

Sardines were once a world staple food. If you need more protein, canned sardines are a good choice. If you need the calories for more energy, eat them in oil. If not, choose those packed in water. High Protein, Low Carbs. A 3.75-ounce can of drained sardines has 191 calories, according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture National Nutrient Database. This amount of sardines also has 22.7 grams of protein and 10.5 grams of total fat. Canned sardines aren't a source of carbohydrates, dietary fibre or sugar. Oct 3, 2017
